學習簡述: It’s when I practice creative writing, whether it’s stories, scripts, or just piecing together my ideas into a storyline.
I learned programming so I can know how it works as well as be a solo game designer.

I like character creation. It’s partially connected to Creative Writing, and partially Digital and Traditional Art. It is creating the appearance or characters, as well as their profiles and identities. However, it happened that all the stories I put didn’t use the characters put here

Digital art is drawing on a tablet that’s virtually connected to the screen. It’s like drawing traditional, but you have easier and more range of colors, and your drawing surface is dissociated from where it appears. While knowing how to draw digitally is easier and useful, I often draw in traditional because it feels more natural to me.
It’s my first language, but I included it here because I had taken a few English related tests, and I needed to study for them.
Traditional art is what is sounds like; the usual drawing on paper, although it’s not limited to just pencil sketches and paintings.

This class was alright. We learned how to write in a sort of resume format, so we could prepare for the future. It’s a nice skill to have in any situation, whether it’s related to jobs or for scholarships. Although it was a bit boring, I feel like it is necessary and it’s a good thing to learn.
Personally, I think the class is pretty interesting. However, it wasn’t a topic I’m interested in, so I wouldn’t put in as much effort as I would like to. But I wouldn’t say I was lazy with my work.
I struggled with paying attention to reading in Chinese, and I had to force myself to reread the same chapters over and over again to get it into my head.

I personally dislike this class, but it’s on the pure basis that I struggled with understanding the poems. I struggled a lot during this class due to my lack of understanding of Chinese poems, and had to rely on translations and Google Translate to comprehend them. But I don’t think(?) the class is bad, but it’s not great either. It’s pretty mundane, in my opinion.

I like this class. We get to learn how podcasts are made, and get to make one ourselves! It was a pretty fun experience in my opinion. I would probably choose a more active role next time (although everyone got involved in the recording in the end product), and I hope we could get more chances or longer recording times.

In this class, I was in the group involved in the environment, and on the topic on safe crab crossing. I had helped do some research and drew the profile picture for our project. But it wasn’t the most interesting class as the topic wasn’t one I was the most interested in, so I couldn’t be as invested as I wanted to. Still, it was an experience.

Psychology is a class I actually like a lot, due to me wanting to use it to make deep, authentic characters as well as understanding myself and people around me. It has helped me understand myself better, and realize things that I didn’t before. I hope we could cover more topics or keep this class in the future.

I really like this class. Philosophy is such an interesting subject, and I have some new ideals and approach to life. I hope we can learn from this class more often and take on more interesting subjects
We learned how to create, execute and finish a plan.

In this class, I focus on my own goals, character creation, doing things thoroughly, researching more than I need. I want to do things right. If my characters has a mental illness, I would research about the symptoms, causes and effects. If I want to make a historical character, I research on that time period. I put a lot of effort in what I do, continuing after school.
The video about iPhones was interesting.

When we went to National Palace Museum, it was very nostalgic for me, as I used to go there all the time whenever I went to Taipei. However, I never explored outside the children’s section, and there were a lot of interesting things to see.
Despite knowing how to speak English and how to construct sentences, I don’t know much about verbs or nouns. I just know what it’s supposed to sound like. So it was helpful to me.
This class didn’t have much of an impression to me. We learned about how to calculate gravity, how we see color, and other interesting things to know, but I wasn’t really interested in.
